intro: Erigeron hirtuosus, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in the summer. Erigeron hirtuosus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ecological value and ornamental appeal.
